house_rules.aditional: Please remove your shoes in the house and treat the space like your own home!

images.title: "What an oasis in the midst of pristine and breathtaking Berkshire beauty! The house itself felt very comfortable and calming." Lenka, January 2024, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

"We loved the place! It’s a very charming home in a beautiful part of the country. It was the perfect spot for a great weekend with friends. Would definitely recommend it!" Rich, December 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
"Absolutely beautiful, clean, and tastefully decorated home in a peaceful and private area." Lauren, July 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
"Augustin's well-maintained home features the perfect balance of New England historical charm with contemporary amenities." Justin, September 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
"We enjoyed our evenings in the sitting room playing games, reading, and talking" Lenka, January 2024, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
"The kitchen was a total delight! Appliances, utensils, spices, coffee, tea...everything we needed to cook and bake and stay cozy (we did not eat out once!)" Lenka, January 2024, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
"We cooked all weekend and the kitchen was well-appointed, with high-end appliances and lovely dishware. It felt very much like being home." Lisa, September 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
"The kitchen is a great place for our family to cook up a storm and create memories." Amy, November 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Many appliances at the house including waffle maker, slow cooker, shabu shabu pot, pressure cooker, rice cooker, raclette machine (not pictured)... and more!
“Beautiful home and area, house has character, loved it. Augustine was always responsive if needed. Definitely would stay again.” Leah, April 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

"We appreciated the loveliness of its original historic self which is well preserved, gorgeous original floors and thoughtful historical details throughout, which did not compromise the utterly modern comfort!" Lenka, January 2024, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

"We loved staying at Augustin’s quintessential colonial house in the Berkshires. Augustin is a great host who was very good at communicating and also accommodating our needs." Amy, November 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
"Easy 5 stars - lovely place and great contact with the hosts. Can’t wait to return in the future" Stephen, November 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
"The rooms are impeccably clean, and their selection of furniture, art, and overall decor exudes exceptional taste", Sitara, October 2023 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

“VERY comfortable beds” Gretchen, June 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
"Fantastic beautifully maintained historic home in an incredibly peaceful and beautiful location." Nathaniel, July 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
“Peaceful, calm location close enough to Great Barrington to go for icecream at SoCo. Great location if you want to bike nearby rail trail. Close to hiking trails.” Gretchen, June 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Bedroom with framed copies of the first edition of « Ye Occasional Idler » the yearly newspaper once published in the house’s attic! Queen bed and roller shades on all windows

"Lovely house. Windows open and listening to the streams was a nice way to fall asleep. The house is well appointed and charming. It’s a good location to explore the Berkshires." Joy, August 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

“Beautiful surroundings, very peaceful. Thank you Augustine, very nice and felt at home.” Leah, April 2023, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

“A lovely house in a beautiful location! Augustin was very responsive and welcoming.” Brian, April 2024, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Smart TV doesn't have cable but many apps, including Netflix!

location_descriptions.title: Getting around
location_descriptions.content:
10 minutes to South Egremont
15 minutes to Great Barrington
30 minutes to Stockbridge
35 minutes to Lenox


The closest town is South Egremont which is 10 mins away, and it covers most of what you need. Here are the shops you'll find there (in order of appearance):
- Cannabis Dispensary
- Wine & Spirits Shop
- Post Office
- Mom's Cafe, serving breakfast and lunch
- Egremont Market, for essential groceries
- The Old Mill, an excellent fine dining restaurant
- Salisbury Bank, with ATM
- "The Shop", a unique local and fun gift shop
- Antique Store
- Acorn, toy store
- Kenver, an outdoor sports store
- Brookside Quiltworks, sewing shop

For an even greater selection of shops, you'll head to Great Barrington which is 5 minutes further from Egremont. There you will find everything you need from large grocery stores, to a movie theater.

description:
Welcome to Maison Berkshires, a nature immersion! This beautiful historic house and red barn are nestled on 7 wooded acres, and surrounded by hundreds more, with no neighbor in sight. A place where everything is made to relax and disconnect: from the serene sounds of the streams running on the property, to the beautifully appointed house. Minutes from stunning hikes like Bash Bish Falls or the Appalachian Trail. 15 mins to Great Barrington and Catamount, 30 mins to Stockbridge, 35 mins to Lenox.

The space
A PLACE TO GATHER

Maison Berkshires has everything you need to create amazing memories with your friends and family. We come here to relax and recharge with our loved ones, and designed everything in the house with that in mind.

This colonial house was built as a summer escape for a Manhattan banker and has an illustrious and quirky history. Babe Ruth used to stay here on his vacation where he hunted and drank a little too much, according to the locals. In the early 20th century, the owner published the town newspaper "Ye Occasional Idler" from a printing press in the attic.

The ground floor includes a large living room with triple exposure windows, a mix of antique and contemporary furniture, and warm blankets to cozy up for those long evening chats. You'll also find a table where we enjoy playing board games, doing puzzles, or having an occasional glass of Berkshire Mountain Distillers Bourbon after dinner. Two doll houses and a "book nook" with a vintage rocking chair complete the space.

The dining room is one of the beating hearts of the house and its antique table sits eight people. We designed it to be warm and inviting and hope you'll spend long evenings here, laughing and enjoying those moments as we do. We usually have a few candles out on the table to create a beautiful setting.

The kitchen is adjacent to the dining room. We cook a lot when in the house so it should have everything you need to prepare delicious meals. If you want to check-in with us first about something you may need, feel free to do so! Equipment includes a 6 burner Wolf stove and many small appliances like a Nespresso coffee machine, rice maker, raclette machine, waffle maker and more... You'll also find a pantry by the kitchen where we keep more cooking stuff.

A sitting room completes the ground floor. Located to your left when you first enter the house, it is meant to be a larger foyer where you can comfortably remove your shoes and coats as you're settling in. You'll find a built-in bookshelf with a collection of books and objects, inspired by the Berkshires and by the history of the house.

The bedrooms are all upstairs and include roller shades on all windows. The Primary bedroom has a beautiful antique queen bed, a desk with printer/scanner, large closet and its own bathroom with a large walk-in shower. The primary bathroom has one of the best views from the house! Another bathroom on that floor is shared by the three other bedrooms. The Blue Room is another large bedroom which features a king bed, a desk, dresser and a half bath with a walk-in closet. There are two more bedrooms on that floor, one with a queen bed, dresser and desk, the other one has a trundle bed, closets and antique chair.

A play room completes the upstairs. It has a tepee, toy kitchen, lots of kids books and many toys! There is also a small couch and a TV in that area. We don't have cable but the smart TV offers apps like Netflix, Amazon Video, and more. The playroom is open to the hallway that leads to the different bedrooms - it isn't a closed off room.

The deck can be accessed from the kitchen and this is where you'll find our Weber grill and an outdoor dining table which seats eight. From the deck you'll take in a stunning view of the surrounding trees while enjoying the shade they provide. You will hear and see our brook on the western side of the house which feeds directly into Bash Bish Falls, the highest waterfall in Massachusetts. It is also a great place to observe the wildlife, like white-tailed deers, wild turkeys, all while listening to the sounds of woodpeckers and other birds.

The barn is where we keep all the fun stuff! It is a gorgeous post and beam barn built by a local master builder with concrete floors and electricity. There you will find everything to entertain, including: a ping pong table, corn hole set, croquet set, balls, badminton net and rackets... and even a treadmill!

The fire pit area with its Adirondack chairs is located next to the barn. We love making s'mores there with the kids and enjoy conversations while staring at the fire.

A hammock is hung in between two large pine trees and is our favorite spot to read books and nap. Next to it is the kid's swing which can either be set as a "big kid" swing or a "small kid" swing. Both swings are kept in the barn when not in use.


A PLACE TO SKI

The house is conveniently located near the two best ski resorts in Southern Berkshires: Catamount Mountain Resort, and Ski Butternut.

Catamount Mountain Resort is 13 minutes away and features 44 ski trails, 39 with snowmaking, and 8 lifts. It offers some of the most varied terrain in Southern New England, and is suited for skiers and snowboarders of all levels.

Ski Butternut offers 22 ski trails, all covered with snowmaking, and 11 lanes for tubing! It is a great and affordable family ski resort.


A PLACE TO HIKE

The property is located in the town of Mount Washington, 80% of which is a nature preserve. Some of the best hikes in the Berkshires are within minutes, including the Appalachian Trail which is 3 miles away. Other notable hikes in the area include:
- Bash Bish Falls, 1.6 miles away
- Mount Everett, 2.2 miles away
- Guilder Pond Hiking Trail, 3 miles away
- Jug end State Reservation, 5 miles away
- and so many more!


A PLACE TO WORK

Sometimes we need to get away from it all to focus and get work done. This house is a great one to do so with:
- Fast Fiber optic internet at 536 mbps
- Eero 6+ mesh Wifi network, for consistent wifi coverage throughout the house
- Printer with flatbed scanner
- Desks in three bedrooms
- Plugs everywhere


DISCLAIMERS / HOUSE TRUTHS

This is an old house so it needs frequent care and upkeep! We fell in love with it and are dedicated to it, but also know that an old house may not be for everyone.
While it is perfectly sound structurally, you will quickly notice that most of the floors are uneven, and that one of the two stairs in the house was built with steeper and shorter steps than what we would build today.
Some of the beautiful windows are original, like many other parts of the house, and have been lovingly restored throughout the years. They are protected on the outside by storm windows which makes for a good insulation, but it also means you need to open two windows if you want to let the fresh air in. No big deal but we want you to be aware of that!
The central forced air heating works very well, and can be controlled from a Nest thermostat in the Sitting Room. The house is located on a small mountain at a 1,500 ft elevation and is surrounded by trees which means the summers here are cooler and no AC was ever needed in the house. It was also built with great cross-ventilation and we have fans throughout the house if need be.

Guest access
Everything!

Unless there is a lock on the door... Three doors are locked in the house: one is a supply closet in the pantry, one leads to the cellar and the other to the attic. In the barn, we ask that you stay on the ground floor, as we use the mezzanine level as a personal storage space. Thank you!

Other things to note
EV charger installed on the property! It is a universal Tesla charger, meaning it works with Teslas and non-Teslas alike! The EV charger is affixed to the south facing side of the house and is available at no extra cost.
title: Beautiful Berkshires Colonial on 7 Acres

reviews.comments: The property was just as described, great for a family stay with lots of amenities, games, etc. Beautiful location with peaceful surroundings and a short trip to great hiking trails.

Beautiful historic home that oozes charm, the setting was straight out of the Hudson River artists’ works. Augustin was a caring, responsive host. We had a great sisters’ week end in this lovely home.

We had the most peaceful, perfect 5 days at Augustins home.. Both my daughter and husband remained technology free the whole time..Which says a lot.. The home has everything you will need..And Augustin is so responsive and full of suggestions for the area..I could go on and on about this beautiful home but all i will say is we will be back..Hopefully very soon..Thank you so very much❤️

This lively house has all the amenities of an Airbnb without that hotel-like feeling. This is a true home with a great yard and barn with much to do. Only 15 minutes to multiple towns and activities. A great waterfall a bike ride away. The hosts were phenomenal and recommended a very cool brunch spot in Great Barrington. Can’t wait to visit again!
reviews.response: Thank you Nicholas! Really glad you enjoyed your stay at our house :)

reviews.comments: Absolutely beautiful country style home.  Loved the wide plank flooring.  Kitchen has everything you need.  Big yard was loved by our dog and location was private, peaceful and only 15 minutes from Great Barrington.  Thanks for a relaxing family weekend!
reviews.response: Thank you Gregory! It was a pleasure welcoming you to our home

reviews.comments: Best place we’ve stayed in, charming yet fully modern house. Renovated with great taste to enjoy a very comfortable stay. We were two couples with young kids and they absolutely loved the available toys, the barn and the big yard. Augustin was a very proactive and attentive host. We would definitely want to come back and highly recommend the place!

We had a group of 6 at Augustin’s beautiful home in the Berkshires, and we are still dreaming of going back! It was the perfect getaway to enjoy the fall foliage, minutes drive to Bash Bish falls, and an easy commute into Great Barrington. The home easily slept 6 of us, with some of the most comfortable beds and comforters we’ve tried! The ambiance and design of the home is charming and cozy. We  enjoyed our coffee (great coffee grinder and maker) on the porch overlooking the trees, or at their beautiful wood dining room table with soft, bubbly tunes playing from the speaker they provide. Cooking is a treat in their fully stacked kitchen. Augustin and Michelle were both really responsive to our messages throughout the stay. If we have our way, we’ll be back!
reviews.response: Thank you Molly! We're really glad you enjoyed your stay in our home!

reviews.comments: We had a great time! My son loved the swing hanging from the tree! The views were amazing the the property was beautiful and peaceful.

We had an incredible stay! This beautiful home served as the perfect home base for us to relax and enjoy the Berkshires. The home is located off of a peaceful, quiet street in the middle of a beautiful forest. The house itself is full of charm and was well appointed! We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

We had the most magical stay in this woodland wonderland! It was the perfect place for our family with two small kids. The house itself is a perfect blend of charming character and modern comfort, while the grounds and amenities made it easy to keep everyone entertained without getting back in the car. Lawn games and swings and bonfires and barn activities made for fun-filled days almost entirely outside enjoying nature. Would love to stay here again!

We had a wonderful stay! The house is really fun with ping pong and a hammock and a swing. Our kids had a great time playing in the beautiful yard. The kitchen is wonderful and easy to cook in. We hope to return soon. Thank you for a great few days.

I have enjoyed three stays so far at the Beautiful Berkshire Colonial. The space continues to live up to expectations and has actually improved with each visit.  The latest enhancement is the stone landscaped seating are around the fire pit. All the home systems work well. The grounds are always well manicured.  The hosts are readily available and responsive to any questions or needs of the guests. If you like the country surrounded by peace, quiet and beauty, you won't be disappointed.

We had a wonderful time staying at this stunning Air Bnb. The home is beautiful. The amenities are modern, yet the place had a rustic feel that was incredibly welcoming in the western Massachusetts’s woods. The lawn was gorgeous. Our children had a blast playing on the swings and learning to play ping pong and croquet. The experience was idyllic. We hope to return!
Stayed for the month of July -- wonderful time in the Berkshires!   Beautiful setting, comfortable home.   Augustin & Michelle were very responsive and helpful.
reviews.response: Thank you John! We are so glad you enjoyed your time here and you are welcome back anytime!

reviews.comments:
They've really thought of everything. We were there in the summer, so when we weren't hiking through the beautiful surroundings, or recuperating from hiking, we played some of the unlimited collection of family games they provided: ping pong and corn hole to name a few. I never knew my wife was so good at ping pong or my son at corn hole !
The same goes for the top end kitchen: not a kitchen appliance missing. In bad weather (and we had NONE of that) you could spend your entire stay cooking whatever you wanted on the Wolf stove or using any of the other tools available. The bedrooms were immaculate and spacious, and the floors were beautiful, bringing you back to the house's origins.
My wife wants us to come back in the Fall and bring our three adult kids again, and Louie the Jack Russell, who felt very welcome.
Beautiful home in a beautiful location! The place looked/was just as described on the website.

Beautiful home and area, house has character, loved it.  Augustine was always responsive if needed. Definitely would stay again. Beautiful surroundings, very peaceful. Thank you Augustine, very nice and felt at home. Leah
A lovely house in a beautiful location! Augustin was very responsive and welcoming.
reviews.response: Thank you very much Brian, we're really glad you enjoyed your stay :)

reviews.comments: We stayed at Augustin’s place for two nights as a group of friends with three infants. The house is very clean, spacious and kid-friendly. The surrounding is beautiful and peaceful. Augustin was very helpful and responsive. His local recommendations about the hikes helped us a lot. It was an amazing place to stay with an outstanding host. We highly recommend Augustin’s place. We definitely want to stay here again.
reviews.response: Thank you very much Cemre! You're welcome back anytime :)

reviews.comments: Really nice place and an enjoyable stay. Great kitchen. Everything was very smooth.
reviews.response: Thank you very much Taylor! Really glad you enjoyed your stay at our house and you’re welcome back anytime

reviews.comments: What an oasis in the midst of pristine and breathtaking Berkshire beauty! The house itself felt very comfortable and calming.  We appreciated the loveliness of its original historic self which is well preserved (gorgeous original floors and thoughtful historical details throughout) which however did not compromise the utterly modern comfort!  The kitchen was a total delight! Appliances, utensils, spices, coffee, tea...everything we needed to cook and bake and stay cozy (we did not eat out once!).  We enjoyed our evenings in the sitting room playing games, reading, and talking.  We would love to visit in the spring or summer, or fall as there is a good sized yard with a fire pit and a nice deck that must be fun in the warmer weather.  Augustine is a great and responsive host - nothing to add here: 100% recommend and hope to visit again.

We had a beautiful and restful 5 days at Augustin’s historic home. Everything was as described. We particularly enjoyed exploring the property. There’s a pristine mountain steam running behind the house—the flowing water is the only sound you hear, aside from the rare car going by. We had 4 kids and 2 dogs, who all love to adventure outdoors. The upper trailhead for Bash Bish Falls is less than a mile away.
The kitchen and baths were perfect. We did a lot of cooking. The only thing we’d recommend is to bring some extra kitchen towels for clean-up and to hand-dry the nice wine and champagne glasses provided.
New laundry machines were much appreciated, as we explored in the woods and got a bit dirty.
The drive up the mountain to the house can be treacherous at night in rough weather—dark and tight turns on narrow roads. So be sure to plan your day trips and grocery shopping accordingly. Once you’re done for the day, it’s best to stay put and simply enjoy the fabulous house.
reviews.response: Thank you very much Amy! Really glad you enjoyed staying at our house and you're welcome back anytime!

reviews.comments: We enjoyed our stay in Augustin’s beautiful Berkshires home. The house was as described and well appointed. The host was very accommodating and quick to respond to any of our questions. Great local recommendations. Highly recommend.
We loved the place! It’s a very charming home in a beautiful part of the country. It was the perfect spot for a great weekend with friends. Would definitely recommend it!

We loved staying at Augustin’s quintessential colonial house in the Berkshires. Augustin is a great host who was very good at communicating and also accommodating our needs. His place is very baby friendly with lots of space and lots and lots of toys. My son actually mastered new skills during our stay and he had so much fun exploring and playing with new toys and books. The place is clean and well organized. The kitchen is a great place for our family to cook up a storm and create memories. We also enjoyed playing games, exploring hikes and towns nearby and watching the stars at night. We would definitely come back here for another visit at a different season.
Easy 5 stars - lovely place and great contact with the hosts. Can’t wait to return in the future
Wonderful home for a family weekend. The lot was beautiful and perfect for our active dogs.

Our Airbnb experience was exceptional thanks to our host's responsiveness and fantastic local recommendations. All questions/concerns we had were met with quick and helpful responses, making the booking process seamless.
The rooms are impeccably clean, and their selection of furniture, art, and overall decor exudes exceptional taste. What truly stood out was the host's commitment to ensuring our stay was as comfortable as possible. I had casually asked if there would be fire starters, and to our surprise, they went the extra mile and ordered them ahead of our check-in. The hosts were also flexible with our check-out because it logistically happened to work out with their cleaner's arrival.
If you're seeking a host who cares deeply about your experience, this is the perfect choice. We can't wait to return for another memorable stay!

We had a wonderful long weekend at Augustin's home. The home is just as described and pictured, and had everything we needed. The kids (ages 14 and 11 1/2) really enjoyed cooking s'mores in the firepit, playing ping pong in the barn, and swinging in the yard. The home has toys and books for young children, as well as puzzles and games for adults. There's lots of space (both inside and outside) to spread out and find your own quiet space. There are several nearby state parks (both in MA and NY) where we enjoyed several hikes. The nights are dark and silent. This would be a great place for a multi-generational family get-away.

We had a wonderful time, just relaxing and enjoying the surroundings.  We cooked all weekend and the kitchen was well-appointed, with high-end appliances and lovely dishware. It felt very much like being home.  There was plenty of room for everyone to either be all together or to find a quiet spot to enjoy a book.  Augustine is a superb host and we are already looking forward to returning!
Old house, very quiet and peaceful, mostly updated and comfortable for our family of 6

We had an incredible Labor Day Weekend with our siblings and young children in large part thanks to Augustin's hospitality.  This home is beautiful, spacious, and well furnished, with a gorgeous and well-equipped kitchen, soft linens and lovely shower products, and toys and games to entertain kids and adults of all ages.   We were six adults and two children in total and we fit comfortably and slept well.  Augustin's well-maintained home features the perfect balance of New England historical charm with contemporary amenities.   The area is breathtaking, woodsy, and rural--the Guilder Pond and Bash Bish hiking trails were very manageable with small kids--and in just 15 minutes you're in downtown Great Barrington with access to delicious restaurants and an impressive arts and culture scene.  I highly recommend a retreat at Augustin's home.

A group of 6 had the most excellent time at this private home. The quiet space near the creek made for a very peaceful surroundings. We took full advantage of the space — playing ping pong, corn-hole, and Crochet. Overall, we had a great time

Beautiful location, akin to staying inside a national park. Augustin’s place is very well equipped for a family friendly stay and made sure at all times we had everything we needed. The site is closely located to several hikes and trail, while Great Barrington’s restaurants and cultural life is ~ 20 min drive.
We would definitely stay here again.
Lovely house. Windows open and listening to the streams was a nice way to fall asleep. The house is well appointed and charming. It’s a good location to explore the Berkshires.
reviews.response: Thank you very much for staying in our home Joy! It was a pleasure welcoming you and I am really glad you enjoyed your stay here.

reviews.comments: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Augustin’s beautiful home (3 couples, 2 kids, 1 dog). It was spacious with especially thoughtful amenities for families traveling with kids. The location is extremely private and I would highly recommend it as a place to stay when you’re trying to get away!
reviews.response: Thank you very much Vimala! We're glad you enjoyed your stay in our home.

reviews.comments: Absolutely beautiful, clean, and tastefully decorated home in a peaceful and private area.  Augustin was responsive and proactive throughout our entire 5 night stay.  There was lots to do right at the house, or just a short drive away into the next town.

The house was exactly as described, an old home beautifully restored and modernized located on a lovely piece of property. The furnishings and beds were very comfortable and inviting, whether in a group or curling up on a chair alone. There were toys and games, a play kitchen and a wonderful dollhouse that my grandchildren loved. The kitchen is gorgeous and supplied with everything possible. And the barn has ping pong table and treadmill. Unfortunately, the remote location made wifi service spotty with no phone service at all. And unless you're willing to drive 20 minutes or so on back roads to the grocery stores, it's important to bring everything you'll need.  Augustin was very helpful with any issues that came up. We thoroughly enjoyed our long weekend and hope to come back another time.
reviews.response: Thank you so much Roberta, it is very nice to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed your trip to Maison Berkshires and want to come back! About the wifi, we have a fiber optic network which delivers high speed Internet, and we have two networks in the house: a 5G one that’s the fastest, and a regular one that has the biggest reach. We’ll work to make this clearer for future guests. Phone reception can be spotty indeed depending on your carrier so we usually place our calls using the house’s wifi. Thanks again for your feedback and we hope to welcome you again soon!

reviews.comments: My elderly mother, toddler, wife and myself certainly benefitted from the peace and tranquility of this house and surroundings. The place is on the edge of a forest, situated between two small creeks that combined with all the bird calls made for terrific background noise. Air quality with so much green around was mostly terrific even with the Canada wildfire smoke always a potential menace. Only concern coming in was confirmed and discussed in advance with Augustin (front stairs present much difficulty climbing for anyone elderly but back stairs were much more managable for mom). Once there, out July visit coincidentally brought with it maybe the only couple of weeks a year where a house A/C would’ve been great.  Still, we managed with the box fans provided and open windows. Overall both Augustin and their beautifully charming and welcoming home are highly recommended.
Fantastic beautifully maintained historic home in an incredibly peaceful and beautiful location.

Beautiful, clean, spacious home in the Berkshires. Super nice kitchen. VERY comfortable beds. Excellent water pressure- nice showers. Peaceful, calm location close enough to Great Barrington to go for icecream at SoCo. Great location if you you want to bike nearby rail trail. Close to hiking trails.  Kid friendly spaces throughout the house. Ours are young adults who enjoyed the pingpong table, hammock and swing. Overall a great spot to land for our extra long weekend.
reviews.response: Thank you vey much Gretchen! It was a pleasure welcoming you and your family to the Berkshires

reviews.comments: Very nice home. Quiet, comfortable and spacious in a beautiful setting. You will enjoy an updated kitchen and a nice deck on which to enjoy socializing and the surrounding sounds of nature.

Augustin, was a consummate communicative host:  open , easygoing and flexible to reasonable requests I had. A great home with “old bones” that sits above a burbling brook, spacious with great flow, tastefully and minimally decorated, a fantastic location encamped in a lush green oasis offering privacy and regional area access.

Our family enjoyed our Memorial Day Weekend stay at Augustin's charming and historic secluded house in the middle of the forest. The house was very comfortable and we enjoyed the fully equipped kitchen, and the kids enjoyed the outdoors, particularly the sports equipment in the barn (table tennis, soccer, and even a bit of croquet). Lots of nature and outdoor hiking fun. Would definitely come back and stay again!

What a beautiful and bucolic gem in the Berkshires. The home is beautifully decorated with a lovely renovated kitchen. Perfect for cooking and looking out upon nature. The house has a gorgeous Americana feel with the barn and large lot surrounded by mature trees. We loved how easy it was to get to great Barrington for a wide selection of food and shopping and also to get into nature with some nearby hikes that are absolutely epic and easy for a family with young kids, like Bish Bash Falls (shorter w a waterfall!) or Jug End (longer). We had a great stay, thanks Augustin!
My wife and I booked the place to get away from the city for a couple days and it was perfect. Fast wifi and very nice decor, along with great fire pit moments. Highly recommend-

prompts.title: What do you do for work?
prompts.subtitle: Tell us what your profession is. If you don’t have a traditional job, tell us your life’s calling. Example: Nurse, parent to four kids, or retired surfer. Where is this shown?

prompts.preview: Where I've always wanted to go
prompts.title: Where have you always wanted to travel?
prompts.subtitle: Whether it's on your bucket list or your short list, tell us a place you can't wait to visit.

textInput.placeholder: Where I've always wanted to go:

prompts.preview: My favorite song in high school
prompts.title: What was your favorite song in high school?
prompts.subtitle: However embarrassing, share the tune you listened to on repeat as a teenager.

textInput.placeholder: My favorite song in high school:

prompts.preview: What makes my home unique: It has everything you need!
prompts.title: What’s the most unique thing about your space?
prompts.subtitle: Share your favorite thing about your place. Example: My record collection or rooftop garden.

prompts.title: Do you have any pets in your life?
prompts.subtitle: Share any pets you have and their names. Example: My calico cat Whiskers, or Leonardo my speedy turtle.

prompts.title: Decade you were born
prompts.subtitle: Don’t worry, other people won’t be able to see your exact birthday.

binaryInput.label: Show the decade I was born

prompts.title: Where did you go to school?
prompts.subtitle: Whether it’s home school, high school, or trade school, name the school that made you who you are.

prompts.preview: I spend too much time: Watching gravel driveway videos
prompts.title: What do you spend too much time doing?
prompts.subtitle: Share an activity or hobby you spend lots of free time on. Example: Watching cat videos or playing chess.

prompts.preview: My fun fact: I collect old cameras!
prompts.title: What’s a fun fact about you?
prompts.subtitle: Share something unique or unexpected about you. Example: I was in a music video or I’m a juggler.

prompts.title: What’s your most useless skill?
prompts.subtitle: Share a surprising but pointless talent you have. Example: Shuffling cards with one hand.

prompts.preview: My biography title would be: Work in Progress
prompts.title: What would your biography title be?
prompts.subtitle: If someone wrote a book about your life, what would they call it? Example: Born to Roam or Chronicles of a Dog Mom.

prompts.preview: Languages I speak: English, French, and Spanish
prompts.title: Languages you speak
prompts.subtitle: Search for a language

prompts.title: What are you obsessed with?
prompts.subtitle: Share whatever you can’t get enough of—in a good way. Example: Baking rosemary focaccia.

prompts.preview: Where I live: New York, NY
prompts.title: Where you live

prompts.preview: For guests, I always: Share local recommendations!
prompts.title: What’s something special you do for guests?
prompts.subtitle: Share something special you do to make guests feel at home. Example: Keep the kitchen stocked or share local recommendations.

prompts.preview: What's for breakfast: Croissants,  scrambled eggs and coffee!
prompts.title: What do you make guests for breakfast?
prompts.subtitle: Share a morning meal you make for guests. If you don’t make them breakfast, skip this one.

reviews.comments: The property was just as described, great for a family stay with lots of amenities, games, etc. Beautiful location with peaceful surroundings and a short trip to great hiking trails.
Clean, quiet and comfortable. Stayed here over a weekend with three friends. Convenient Woodlands location and the place was perfectly situated for our crew.

A hidden gem in Brooklyn surrounded by great places to eat, walkable to playgrounds, gardens, parks and zoo and an easy ride to Manhattan on the subway! The hosts were super helpful and responsive and gave so many local recommendations for the local neighborhood we took advantage of! And if you have kids, look no further this place has everything and more to help your little one feel at home!
a
Perfect if you're traveling with family. Well equipped to travel with little ones. Great location. Was easy to park and near subway line. Surprisingly spacious for NYC/Brooklyn!
reviews.response: Thank you Freddy! It was a pleasure having you

reviews.comments: Augustin was an exemplary guest and I would highly recommend him and his family. He left the house in spotless condition, was wonderful to communicate with and was extremely personable to boot. We would be delighted to host him anytime and would recommend him to any other host as an A+ guest. Come back to Capri soon, Gus!
Très sympathique,prévenant et appartement rendu en bon état. Je recommande

translation.comments: Very friendly,considerate and apartment returned in good condition. Recommended

reviews.comments:
C’était un plaisir de le recevoir. 
Bon respect des lieux, Je peux  les recommander.

translation.comments:
It was a pleasure to receive it. 
Good respect for the premises, I can recommend them.

reviews.comments: Augustin left my place tidy and communicated their plans clearly. I would recommend them highly as guests to all other Airbnb hosts.

It was a pleasure to have Agustin and his group at home, they took good care of the apartment and left it in good conditions, I would be glad to welcome them again. Many thanks for coming and I wish you all the best, 
Maria x

userProfile.about: Parisian living in Brooklyn. Author of « Secret Brooklyn » an unusual guidebook about Brooklyn’s most surprising places! Entrepreneur, water tower enthusiast

managedListings.nameOrPlaceholderName: Beautiful Brooklyn Townhouse w/ Patio & Fios
